qutoes.quote: We have now sunk to a depth at which restatement of the obvious is the first duty of intelligent men.
qutoes.author: George Orwell

qutoes.quote: We've got no money, so we've got to think.
qutoes.author: Ernest Rutherford

qutoes.quote: Risk comes from not knowing what you're doing.
qutoes.author: Warren Buffett

qutoes.quote: Nine men can not have a baby in a month.
qutoes.author: Bob Frampton

qutoes.quote: A common mistake that people make when trying to design something foolproof is to underestimate the ingenuity of complete fools.
qutoes.author: Douglas Adams

qutoes.quote: Common sense is the collection of prejudices acquired by age 18.
qutoes.author: Albert Einstein

qutoes.quote: Imagination is the one weapon in the war against reality.
qutoes.author: Jules de Gaultier

qutoes.quote: Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored.
qutoes.author: Aldous Huxley

qutoes.quote: When it's a question of money, everybody is of the same religion.
qutoes.author: Voltaire

qutoes.quote: Anyone who has ever made a mistake has never tried anything new.
qutoes.author: Albert Einstein

qutoes.quote: Once you can accept the universe as matter expanding into nothing that is something, wearing stripes with plaid comes easy.
qutoes.author: Albert Einstein

qutoes.quote: If you have an apple and I have an apple and we exchange apples then you and I will still each have one apple. But if you have an idea and I have an idea and we exchange these ideas, then each of us will have two ideas.
qutoes.author: George Bernard Shaw

qutoes.quote: It is said that papers in string theory are published at a rate greater than the speed of light. This, however, is not problematic since no information is being transmitted.
qutoes.author: H. Kleinert

qutoes.quote: Happiness is not achieved by the conscious pursuit of happiness; it is generally the by-product of other activities.
qutoes.author: Aldous Huxley

qutoes.quote: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has mad a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move.
qutoes.author: Douglas Adams

qutoes.quote: Crash plans fail because they are based on the theory that, with nine women pregnant, you can get a baby a month.
qutoes.author: Wernher von Braun

qutoes.quote: A theory is something nobody believes, except the person who made it. An experiment is something everybody believes, except the person who made it.
qutoes.author: Albert Einstein

qutoes.quote: Last words are for fools who haven't said enough.
qutoes.author: Karl Marx

qutoes.quote: Get your facts first, and then you can distort them as much as you please.
qutoes.author: Mark Twain

qutoes.quote: I skate to where the puck is going to be, not where it has been.
qutoes.author: Wayne Gretsky

qutoes.quote: Not all those who wanter are lost.
qutoes.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

qutoes.quote: Imagination governs the world.
qutoes.author: Napoleon

qutoes.quote: Take-offs are optional, landings are mandatory.
It wouldn't hurt that long, you would be killed almost instantly.
qutoes.author: Michael Goudeau

qutoes.quote: All science is either physics or stamp-collecting.
qutoes.author: Ernest Rutherford

qutoes.quote: If I occasionally neglect to cite a theorist, it's not because I've forgotten. It's probably because I hate him.
qutoes.author: Leon Lederman

qutoes.quote: I don't know what I may seem to the world. But as to myself I seem to have been only like a boy playing on the seashore and diverting myself now and then finding a smoother pebble or a prettier shell that the ordinary, while the great ocean of truth lay all undiscovered before me.
qutoes.author: Isaac Newton

qutoes.quote: A stand can be made against invasion by an army; no stand can be made agains invasion by an idea.
qutoes.author: Victor Hugo

qutoes.quote: A government which robs Peter to pay Paul can always depend on the support of Paul.
qutoes.author: George Bernard Shaw

qutoes.quote: I don't want to die without any scars.
qutoes.author: Chuck Palahniuk

qutoes.quote: If you want to make enemies, try to change something.
qutoes.author: Woodrow Wilson

qutoes.quote: It's not what you look at that matters, it's what you see.
qutoes.author: Henry David Thoreau

qutoes.quote: A research man is endlessly searching to find a use for something that has no use.
qutoes.author: Gordon Teal

qutoes.quote: Be fearful when others are greedy and greedy when others are fearful.
qutoes.author: Warren Buffett

qutoes.quote: Because people who are crazy enough to think that they can change the world, usually do.
qutoes.author: Steve Jobs

qutoes.quote: Everyone has a plan until they get punched in the mouth.
qutoes.author: Mike Tyson

qutoes.quote: Those who live by the sword will be shot by those who don't.
qutoes.author: Gary Hamel

qutoes.quote: If I had 60 minutes to solve a problem, I'd spend 55 minutes defining it, and 5 minutes solving it.
qutoes.author: Albert Einstein

qutoes.quote: The best way to predict the future is to invent it.
qutoes.author: Alan Kay

qutoes.quote: Failure is simply the opportunity to begin again, this time more intelligently.
qutoes.author: Henery Ford

qutoes.quote: The three most harmful addictions are heroin, carbohydrates, and a monthly salary.
qutoes.author: Fred Wilson

qutoes.quote: It's kinda fun to do the impossible.
qutoes.author: Walt Disney

qutoes.quote: Inside every large problem is a small problem struggling to get out.
qutoes.author: Tony Hoare

qutoes.quote: The mark of greatness is when everything before you is obsolete, and everything after you bears your mark.
qutoes.author: Dave Chappelle

qutoes.quote: Simplicity is the key to brilliance.
qutoes.author: Bruce Lee

qutoes.quote: You can observe a lot just by watching.
qutoes.author: Yogi Berra

qutoes.quote: To understand is to invent.
qutoes.author: Angelo Patri

qutoes.quote: You can't build a reputation on what you're going to do.
qutoes.author: Henry Ford

qutoes.quote: Education is what remains after one has forgotten what one has learned in school.
qutoes.author: Albert Einstein

qutoes.quote: There is no substitute for hard work.
qutoes.author: Thomas Edison

qutoes.quote: If you don't innovate and address who your customers are, you become irrelevant.
qutoes.author: Jeff Bezos

qutoes.quote: The only difference between stumbling blocks and stepping stones is the way in which we use them.
qutoes.author: Adriana Doyle

qutoes.quote: You cannot force inspiration but you can woo it.
qutoes.author: Cynthia Wen

qutoes.quote: Thoroughly conscious ignorance is the prelude to every real advance in science.
qutoes.author: James Clerk Maxwell

qutoes.quote: The great obstacle of discovering the shape of the earth, the continents and the ocean was not ignorance but the illusion of knowledge.
qutoes.author: Daniel J. Boorstin

qutoes.quote: Science is always wrong. It never solves a problem without creating 10 more.
qutoes.author: George Bernard Shaw

qutoes.quote: In an honest search for knowledge, you quite often have to abide by ignorance for an indefinite period.
qutoes.author: Erwin Schrodinger

qutoes.quote: If at first glance the idea does not seem absurd, there is no hope for it.
qutoes.author: Albert Einstein

qutoes.quote: There’s nothing efficient about innovation.
qutoes.author: Simon Sinek

qutoes.quote: The reasonable man adapts to the world; the unreasonable one persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore, all progress depends on the unreasonable man.
qutoes.author: George Bernard Shaw

qutoes.quote: If you’re not failing every now and again, it’s a sign you’re not doing anything very innovative.
qutoes.author: Woody Allen

qutoes.quote: Inventing is the mixing of brains and materials. The more brains you use, the less materials you need.
qutoes.author: Charles Kettering

qutoes.quote: The strategy of “they did that, so we’ve gotta do that” is a failed strategy.
qutoes.author: Dick Costolo

qutoes.quote: To live a creative life, we must lose our fear of being wrong.
qutoes.author: Joseph Chilton Pearce

qutoes.quote: Inspiration is for amateurs; the rest of us just show up and get to work.
qutoes.author: Chuck Close

qutoes.quote: Just because something doesn't do what you planned it to do doesn't mean it's useless.
qutoes.author: Thomas Edison

qutoes.quote: If you want to build a ship, don’t her people together to collect wood and don’t assign them tasks and work; but rather teach them to long for the endless immensity of the sea.
qutoes.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

qutoes.quote: Always do more than is expected of you.
qutoes.author: George S Patton

qutoes.quote: The opposite for courage is not cowardice, it is conformity.
qutoes.author: Jim Hightower

qutoes.quote: Even a dead fish can go with the flow.
qutoes.author: Jim Hightower

qutoes.quote: You’ll never get ahead of anyone as long as you try to get even with him.
qutoes.author: Lou Holtz

qutoes.quote: Design is not how things look; it's how things work.
qutoes.author: Steve Jobs

qutoes.quote: Every great advance in natural knowledge has involved the absolute rejection of authority.
qutoes.author: Thomas Huxley

qutoes.quote: Those who live by the sword, get shot by those who don’t.
You don’t have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great.
qutoes.author: Zig Zagler

qutoes.quote: You can’t be remarkable by following someone else who’s remarkable.
qutoes.author: Seth Godin

qutoes.quote: We have to continually be jumping off cliffs and developing our wings on the way down.
qutoes.author: Kurt Vonnegut

qutoes.quote: Out there in some garage is an entrepreneur who's forging a bullet with your company's name on it. You've got one option now-to shoot first. You've got to out-innovate the innovators.
qutoes.author: Gary Hamel

qutoes.quote: Innovation is the sloppy seconds of invention.
The future is already here - it’s just not very evenly distributed.
qutoes.author: William Gibson

qutoes.quote: Innovation begins with an eye.
qutoes.author: Leon Segal

qutoes.quote: The best way to get a good idea is to get a lot of ideas.
qutoes.author: Linus Pauling
